user_profile: Khoa-Andrew enjoys exploring a wide range of cuisines—from fresh sushi and vibrant Thai to classic New Orleans French‑Creole, hearty Mexican tacos, and premium steaks—favoring spots that offer generous portions, fresh ingredients, and the ability to customize dishes. He prefers lively yet comfortable atmospheres: casual, family‑friendly eateries with plenty of seating, music (often piano or live) and TV screens, as well as more upscale, classy venues with a relaxed, intimate vibe for special occasions. Friendly, attentive service delivered promptly is important, and he appreciates staff who are flexible with menu substitutions and quick to correct minor slip‑ups. While he values good value and isn’t averse to modest prices, he’s willing to spend more for quality and ambiance, expecting prices to match portion size and overall experience. Practical conveniences such as bike parking, credit‑card acceptance, take‑out/delivery options, and easy reservations (especially at higher‑end restaurants) are appreciated, and he shows a forgiving attitude toward occasional seasoning issues but expects overall consistency and cleanliness.

chosen.business_profile: Jasmine Rice Thai Cuisine is a casual Thai restaurant in Gretna, LA offering moderately priced dishes in a family‑owned, no‑frills setting with an average noise level and a TV for diners; it provides full table service, accepts credit cards, and is wheelchair accessible with convenient lot parking. The venue focuses on dinner service but also accommodates lunch, delivering consistent, authentic Thai flavors—guests frequently cite well‑balanced heat and reliably good Pad Thai and other classics—while staff are noted for courteous service. Practical perks include delivery, takeout, and credit‑card acceptance, though there is no outdoor seating, Wi‑Fi, or reservation option, and dogs are not permitted. This combination of affordable, solid Thai fare, a relaxed indoor atmosphere, and easy parking makes it a convenient choice for casual meals, especially dinner, while the lack of outdoor space and reservations may limit flexibility for larger or special‑occasion gatherings.

chosen.review_text:
This is a small Thai place located on the West Bank. The food was very good! The service is very friendly, fast, and attentive. 

PROS: The portions are large! I had to take the rest of my food home to eat. The food was well cooked and tasted great. The spice levels are 1-5 and they're pretty on the spot with their levels. The atmosphere is very cozy making the experience more enjoyable. 

CONS: The shumai is a pretty small plate for the price. $8 for 4 small ones. 

Overall, this is my go to Thai place on the West Bank! I'd highly recommend if looking for a place for Thai food.

rejected.review_text:
Came here for Valentine's Day with my family and celebrated my birthday. 

PROS: 
-Great ambiance
-Very cozy and friendly staff
-Quite a wide selection of food from appetizers, entrees, sides, and more
-Friendly staff and great service 

CONS:
-I ordered the Prime Cajun Ribeye and it the seasoning on top was very blackened. It tasted more like a burnt seasoning rather than Cajun. Tasted good for the first few moments of eating, then got a bit tired of it. The sides overall were nothing special. Lobster Mac and Truffle fries were average. The Lobster MAC especially for the price felt subpar. 

Overall enjoyed my time there because of the experience. If you're looking for a phenomenal steak with a unique food tasting experience, I would skip and try elsewhere. As a restaurant, nice place. As a steakhouse, subpar.

rejected.review_text:
It's New Years Day.  2017.  We were dining at CB today because my Mom loves it.  I'm sure they were short staffed because of the holiday; however, this was the worst dining experience.  We ordered two plates of "beans and greens" with cornbread to be delivered prior to the meal.  My husband ordered the blackberry cobbler.  Tea for the three of us.  
5:00 pm ordered
5:13. Sorry we don't have cornbread.  It will be 7 min. 
5:20. "Sorry, we don't have blackberry cobbler but we do have peach".  Okay
5:30. Beans and greens delivered.  No cornbread. 
5:35.  Surprise.  We had blackberry cobbler.  Cobbler was cold.  
5:40.  We got 3 cornbread muffins.  
Asked if we could get the black eyed peas.  Server just happened to have some on his tray for another table.  He gave us those.  Peas were cold.  Asked if he could warm them.  
5:45. Server asked if he could get us anything.  Yes, biscuits to go with butter and jam
5:50.  Server brought a small bag of warm cornbread with butter and jam. 
As I was leaving, I happened to notice broken glass under my chair.  Picked up a few of the larger pieces and left them on the table.  
Sigh.  I left without biscuits.

user_profile: Jaclyn is an upbeat, easygoing diner who gravitates toward bright, friendly spots where the staff greet you with a smile and service is swift, especially when she’s in a hurry for a quick bite. She prefers Asian flavors—sushi and Chinese fare at casual eateries like Chopstick Express, fresh boba teas and light snacks at places like Kaleisia Tea Lounge, and sweet frozen treats at ice‑cream cafés such as IceBurg—favoring fresh, made‑to‑order items over pre‑packaged powders. Her ideal ambiance is relaxed and family‑friendly: casual dress code, quiet to moderately lively noise level, child‑welcome environments, and often with outdoor seating when available. She values convenience highly, seeking venues with ample bike or lot parking, take‑out or delivery options, and long or holiday hours (open late into the night and on holidays). Price‑wise she leans toward budget‑friendly menus (price range 1–2) but is willing to pay a bit more for quality drinks. Overall, Jaclyn is forgiving and enthusiastic, rewarding places that combine friendly staff, quick and reliable service, and a welcoming, laid‑back atmosphere.

Practical conveniences matter to her: she likes venues that offer takeout or delivery, accept credit cards, provide easy parking, and are wheelchair accessible, while she is forgiving overall but expects food quality to match the casual, comfortable vibe of the establishment.

chosen.review_text: It has enough for children as young as two. A couple food and snack stands (lines will be long but worth the wait food is fresh). I noticed this farm does not sell apple cider or cider doughnuts (but I've only been to Jersey farms prior to this visit). My family enjoyed this farm. Be mindful of the time period you go- October is harvest time, so you will not be able to experience the sunflower field, or apple picking. I also noticed lights were being put up so we will definitely visit for that.

user_profile: Rachel is a enthusiastic foodie who gravitates toward hearty American comfort dishes, especially cheesesteaks and other steak‑centric plates packed with bold, spicy toppings like peppers and onions. chosen.review_text:
Alright there's Philly cheesesteaks then there's Philly cheesesteaks that place over there does it wrong then there's place like Cleavers that are doing it right in many different ways you decide what ones for you!

Coming here was kinda an adventure but very much worth it as the building was boarded up leaving only the sign on the roof and an arrow pointing to the door handle as this location is downtown and due to current situations that's why it's like this.

Once inside they have a small little area to eat next to the bar area again they have limited seating because of the world right now either way it was still awesome to eat inside and get this delicious Philly hot right in front of me on this cold rainy day!

Of the delicious choices I totally went with the Effin Hot Steak as I love hot peppers and onions on my steak as that's just what's totally good and this cheesesteak was just that a pile of cheesy steak pepper and onion goodness that was huge on a delicious fresh baked bun that just was perfect in soo many ways!

Could this be the best of the cheesesteaks I've ever had I totally think yes as it was just super awesome from start to finish as you really couldn't go wrong in anyway!

Our server/bartender was awesome she was in top of it and very particular about distancing and the way she went about it which was totally what's good!

Overall there really wasn't anything that went down here that wasn't just awesome as my effin hot steak was beyond perfect so much so that I really hope to make it back here again because it's totally just what's good in soo many cheesy ways!

Want to hear a robot? Want to have a perfectly good check be denied for no particular reason on multiple occasions? Want to talk to a human about a real life situation?

Well too bad you can't have anything but a headache as that's all this company does as it's very clear they don't know anything about you but for some reason they think they do!

So this company is used by a bunch of banks and businesses to verify a check and for some reason they seem to think it's okay to deny perfectly good checks I've never had any issues with this until a few years ago basically when this horrible pathetic excuse for a company came into play I know I'm not the only one who is annoyed by them as I've seen multiple people be denied using a check at work because of these jerks!

For me I have had several good checks denied for no reason at all some have even been payroll checks from a very reputable company there is no reason for this at all like give me my money it's legit!

I'm beyond annoyed by this company they need to be brought down as I know I'm not the only one who hates them yes I'm using the word hate because there is no better description than the word hate for such a waste of time and for the problems they have caused me and others right in front of me with their lack of care for people's lives!

Overall this company is a annoying sham with horrible business practices beyond poor customer service standards and a out of date database that doesn't know anything but how to create drama and deny you from cashing or depositing a perfectly good check I'm sure you too will get a headache from them sooner than later!

rejected.review_text: Ive heard rumbles of this place for some time. I know it is beloved in the Philippines and in most of Asia. I decided to try it because they location is actually not that far from me. My first impression of the place was that it seemed very themed. I can definitely see this place working on orlando. It looked like a restaurant t on either Disney or Universal property. I had the chicken joy and the palabak(not sure if I'm saying it correctly but it's the rice noodles with pork and shrimp). The chicken itself was pretty good. It gave me KFC vibes rather than Popeyes. The palabak itself was kind of bizarre. Perhaps if I was a someone who grew up on it I may have appreciated it better. However the peach pie and their popular pineapple drink was delicious. I wouldn't necessarily choose this over the American power houses (chick fil a, Popeyes, shake shack, etc) but it's a nice addition.

rejected.review_text:
It's what can be expected for service as far as Wal-Mart goes. Keep in mind at any Wal-Mart, you are going for the low price, not adequate staff or customer service. I appreciate the self service aisles. For those of us who know how to use them, they are a quick check-out option.

I think this Wal-Mart is far from the highest quality Wal-Mart that I have set foot. They aren't particularly dirty or poorly stocked, but I do not feel comfortable shopping here. I think some of my feelings may be provoked by the other shoppers. The store is always packed and the other patrons are often loud and discourteous, which makes for a poor shopping experience. But I say again, I don't go to Wal-Mart for the great time, I go for the cheap price.

As a final impression, I would prefer to not shop at this Wal-Mart, even though I love the chain, and I wait until I am in dire need of a product before setting foot in this store. I will be glad when I finish my service in the Brandon area and I can return to a more pleasant Wal-Mart to shop.

rejected.review_text: I have been craving a banana split for a while now, so I finally went to Dairy Inn with my husband and son. I use to go to this Dairy Inn all the time as a kid and was feeling nostalgic and happy to bring my son there. Well... it's certainly not what it use to be. I looked at the soft serve machine and it looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a while. I ignored that and just told myself it would be fine. Definitely wasn't fine. The ice cream in my banana split was already melting when she handed me the boat. It was a weird watery opaque color. Then as I was walking to the car I noticed a bruise on the banana. Being as I work with food myself, I thought, "oh come on they couldn't cut that off of there?" Then I took a bite of rancid strawberries. If you all are going to serve your banana splits with fresh fruits instead of the canned stuff, then please make sure your strawberries and pineapples are not rancid. I'm not sure what's happening there but I'd be willing to bet those strawberries and pineapples were out of date... if they were even dated at all. Disgusting do you all really think people don't taste that?? I will not be going back.

chosen.review_text:
Yes, this place lives up to the hype! The pulled chicken, the sweet potato fries, the corn--all excellent. The fries were some of the best I've ever had, seasoned well with brown sugar and just the right amount of crispness.
With a lot of places like Pappy's, they lose their vibe and personality as their fame grows. Not the case here. Prices are still reasonable, food is quality, and the service was so friendly. Prepare to wait in line a while, but it's well worth it!

rejected.review_text:
At KFC I like to get chicken fingers with buffalo flavored sauce, not the Texas Pete flavored hot sauce that they always try to give you. I never have a problem asking for buffalo sauce on the side at most KFC locations, and while this location used to give me that option, they recently stopped and wanted to charge me more money for something that I can get for free at another location.

When a man takes his food a certain way and you deny that service, you lose a customer. Unfortunately for KFC, this means losing a steady customer who ate there frequently because he worked right down the street. There are other places to shop.

rejected.review_text: The response I received from management to my initial review did not really address any issues depicted in the pictures I posted, instead I got a snide comment about people who usually stay in the Hollywood bungalow room do because they can't afford the bigger, nicer rooms, essentially. I actually chose the room because it looked like fun. This is such a tacky way to diffuse responsibility for the obvious problems the Hollywood Bungalow room has. Changing the mattress, and acknowledging the fact that the room has a mildew smell isn't going to make a difference, sorry to say. But if you want me to use the managements words against them, then I guess you get what you paid for, right? (Unless you paid the price for a boutique bed and breakfast experience). Please take responsibility for the quality of the room and stop trying to place blame on your guests, like maybe if I was willing to pay more I could have gotten a better room. You know what the room looks like and what's wrong with it- fix it.

rejected.review_text:
Went to Tito & Pep for a date night. The restaurant was super cute and very cozy since it's towards the smaller size, which I liked a lot. The decor was beyond cute and semi-retro. We started with the calamari which was very good and I especially liked the roasted garlic pieces that were mixed in the basket, along with the jalapeños. I'm generally a seafood eater so I chose the salmon. I really enjoyed the crispy skin and the roasted radishes they plated it with. My boyfriend went with the pork chop which blew me away. Probably the best pork I've had; it was very tender, flavorful, and not even close to being dry. This restaurant would've had 5 stars had the drinks been a little better. They tasted great, don't get me wrong, but they were very lightly poured. Amazing service and we had a server, Ashley, with an amazing personality. 

Overall I'd definitely go back and would recommend the pork!

The market’s strengths include competitive pricing, high‑quality prepared foods, helpful staff who slice deli meats to request, and a well‑stocked bakery for cakes and pies, making it suitable for families and shoppers looking for one‑stop dining and grocery needs; the primary limitation is the lack of delivery and limited indoor seating, which may require patrons to plan visits around parking availability.
